unnormalised: EdTech startup 'ShikshaNow' just raised ₹20 Cr in Series A funding! Big news for the online learning space in India. Investors seem bullish on their personalized learning modules aimed at students in Classes 6-12.
normalised: Ed-Tech startup 'ShikshaNow' just raised rupee twenty crore in Series A funding! Big news for the online learning space in India. Investors seem bullish on their personalized learning modules aimed at students in Classes six to twelve.

unnormalised: ShikshaNow's platform offers live classes, recorded lectures, and doubt-solving sessions. They claim a 90% student satisfaction rate. Their app has been downloaded over 5 lakh times. The co-founder, Ms. Priya Sharma, mentioned a plan to use the funds for expanding their reach to Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities.
normalised: ShikshaNow's platform offers live classes, recorded lectures, and doubt-solving sessions. They claim a ninety percent student satisfaction rate. Their app has been downloaded over five lakh times. The co-founder, M-S Priya Sharma, mentioned a plan to use the funds for expanding their reach to Tier-two and Tier-three cities.

unnormalised: Competition in the EdTech market is heating up, with Byju's, Unacademy, and Vedantu already dominating the space. ShikshaNow's focus on vernacular content could give them an edge. They currently offer courses in Hindi, Marathi, and Bengali, with plans to add more regional languages.
normalised: Competition in the Ed-Tech market is heating up, with Byju's, Unacademy, and Vedantu already dominating the space. ShikshaNow's focus on vernacular content could give them an edge. They currently offer courses in Hindi, Marathi, and Bengali, with plans to add more regional languages.

unnormalised: Experts are saying that the Indian EdTech market could reach $4 billion by 2025. The shift to online learning accelerated during the COVID-19 pandemic. Many schools and colleges are now integrating online resources into their curriculum.
normalised: Experts are saying that the Indian Ed-Tech market could reach dollar four billion by two thousand and twenty five. The shift to online learning accelerated during the C-O-V-I-D-nineteen pandemic. Many schools and colleges are now integrating online resources into their curriculum.

unnormalised: This latest funding round values ShikshaNow at ₹150 Cr. They are also looking to hire 200+ new employees in the next 6 months. Exciting times for the EdTech sector, especially with NEP 2020 pushing for more tech integration in education.
normalised: This latest funding round values ShikshaNow at rupee one hundred and fifty crore. They are also looking to hire two hundred plus new employees in the next six months. Exciting times for the Ed-Tech sector, especially with N-E-P two thousand and twenty pushing for more tech integration in education.
